Ok, just for you guys! These are the translations in English and Spanish I've been working on for those who really are interested, I really liked this work so I might as well do the work of helping those who want to understand the story, keep in mind it's only the raw translation, that mean plain text if you want it along with the art then you'll have to wait for someone else, I'll try update it as fast as I'm able to do.

@LeCaster Yeah I know what you mean!, and yes the boyfriend is never present just mentioned, and all the guys there, expect background characters which are players, are her teammates, he brags about having her in the passenger seat, then offers idk what item it is so she notices his throbbing cock lol, of course she already suspected, I mean it was pretty obvious lol, then he says that he can't no longer bare it and it's her fault for that lewd body so if she does it with her mouth he will be relieved right away, and It'll be a secret between then so for that reason, pretty please? and because she really wants to win well... Anyhow I only speak a little and translating is hard because even though you understand it in Japanese in English is a bit harder to make sense of some parts, so let's just wait, it's a great work this one. Hope there's a sequel!

@PineappleLite I know there are some variants on the fetish- netorare, netorase and netori, depending on the focus of the characters that works as proxy in the story (if he/she is losing/being taken/or taking the object of love/lust in the story, however there's something I don't get in this particular story- is she supposed to have a boyfriend who we never see? Because she's mainly with the blond guy who seems happy to share her (who also is the guy she sucks -not-so-in-secret- at the car). Isn't netorare, by definition, supposed to focus on the emotional pain of losing the loved one (which isn't present here whatsoever). But hey, don't mind me, I'm bitching about how the NTR tag is thrown in a bunch of stories, usually mistaken with cheating/swinging/sharing/rape, but whatever. In any case, I thank you in advance if you're translating this, that will surely help to clarify things!

@LeCaster So at first is only cheating (her, agreeing to suck the guy off as a secret), but then it turns clearly into NTR because they steal the girl from her boyfriend. And there are many or at least 3 main NTR subdivisions or whatever lol one is where someone steals the girl of another man when the girl doesn't want to, so it's kinda forced but then she gets hooked and you know, anyway I started translating it but it's a lot of work to be honest

@LeCaster (Yeah I'm that of a newfag) I actually speak a little bit of Japanese but reading/writing is what is most difficult for me but from what I understand the girl is a college student but got addicted to the game, when the guys see this born-to-breed babe as their teammate they start asking her questions and one of those is "Do you have a boyfriend?" and "Why he doesn't play with you" to what she answers "Yes" and "Because he doesn't like it", so the reason she stays with them is because they're supposed to be pro players (though I think they use a cheat later on lmao) and she desperately wants a Winner Winner Chicken Dinner, in order words wants to win a game, so stays with them and sucks the guy because he's hard as fuck thanks to her lewd body, so the excuse is they can't concentrate but if she helps them relieve even with her mouth then they could win, she agrees because it was supposed to be a secret only between them.
Winner winner pussy dinner. Am i right hmm..??

PineappleLite Is it NTR because of the single image where the blond guy who I guess is her boyfriend/lover/main guy or whatever is giving his back while other guy is fucking her? Because he seems happy to share her through the story, and sharing isn't ntr- by definition, in ntr the lover/husband/boyfriend should feel bad about his partner having sex with someone else, regardless if he's ok or aroused or even promoting it, the keypoint is his pain about it.
By the definition it is, though at first it was only cheating then it turned NTR at the end, still pretty good though where did they get this I thought the artists were updating it 4 pages a month
This isn't netorare... Perhaps ntr would be less hated if the sites could stop tagging everything as netorare... (nah, I know it wouldn't)
